title: Doe Park Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: David Spencer / Doe Park reservoir
images.caption: Doe Park reservoir. Looking eastwards along the dam from the vicinity of the Water Activities Centre

images.title: David Spencer / Detail of ironwork at Doe Park Reservoir
images.caption: Detail of ironwork at Doe Park Reservoir. Cast into the ironwork is the legend 'J & J CLIFF. OLD FOUNDRY. BRADFORD. 1861.'

images.caption: Sailboats in the summer

images.title: Tim Green from Bradford, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: An autumnal view

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Doe Park Reservoir
images.caption: Footpath near the southeast corner of Doe Park Reservoir. The many springs and small streams on the hillside mean the path spends much of its time underwater, a problem which was overcome by placing thick flagstones along the path like a series of stepping stones, and more recently by wooden planks covered in wire mesh to prevent slipping.

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Doe Park Reservoir
images.caption: Footbridge crossing Denholme Beck where it flows into the southern end of Doe Park Reservoir, on the path from Halifax Road to Ten Yards Lane.

images.title: Betty Longbottom / Bowling Green - Foster Park, Denholme
images.caption: Bowling Green Foster park

description: This circular walk explores Doe Park Reservoir in Denholme, near Bradford in West Yorkshire. The route takes you along the dam and the lake before visiting Foster Park in Denholme. It's a pleasant and peaceful place for a walk with fine views across the water to the rolling hills beyond. You'll often see sailboats and a variety of birdlife on the water too. On the route there's also views of the Denholme Beck and Capereley Beck before visiting the pleasant trails in Foster Park. The reservoir is also home to Doe Park Water Activities Centre where you can try sailing, canoeing, kayaking, dragon boating and raft building.
